review_title: I thought it was going to a great change
pros: Nice to work from home
cons: I’m sad that the team is not appreciated by the hospital and departments that we take the calls for. The supervisors work harder than upper leaders like managers and it’s obvious that they are Stretched very thin. I have worked an environment were the supervisors worked hard and are too tired to attend to their team. Upper management is very lazy and never at work. I’m surprised that my supervisor is still with the company since there has been a lot of change. The seniors are rude and get smart with you, so you don’t want to ask questions. I’d rather just get an error than ask them for help, and the trainers do not know much about questions and their supervisor is always talking and acting inappropriate. I think the vaccine mandate should not have been for the call center since we work from home. This place has changed in the 8 months I have been here. Just working thru winter months then I’m out

review_title: Fully committed to Children, young adults, their families and ACH Employees
pros:
1. Deeply invested passionate clinicians. Everyone is quite focused on delivering the best care
2. Committed to ALL children, young adults and their families
3. More and more inclusive. Feels like we are daily discovering unique needs of the patient populations we serve. As an ethnic and cultural minority, I feel welcome and that leadership wants to do right by me and every employee. 
4. New CEO really wants to connect with everyone and appears to be a good listener
cons:
1. National name is missing, despite being such an awesome children's hospital. The care delivered and the quality of people far exceeds the national brand.
2. Like all of healthcare, workers are exhausted and being asked to do more

pros: Working with kids is great, and my coworkers are wonderful.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Akron, OH
pros: The number one reason I applied here was because of the amazing tuition reimbursement program. I have been able to complete my degree with very little out-of-pocket expense. They seem to perform regular market analysis to stay competitive with wages. Regular raises, wellness program and retirement are all great!
cons: I think the health insurance is spectacular if you have small children. As an adult, it is expected that we will go out of network (to an adult hospital) for services. This can result in a higher out-of-pocket expense. I would like the option of having a PPO that allows me to choose which hospital would be considered my primary, but I don't know if that exists anywhere.

review_title: Excellent environment, fast-paced place to learn and grow
pros: Lots of comradery. Unique culture. Some of my best friends were my co-workers. I felt proud of my job at one of the top children's hospitals in the U.S. and enjoyed going to work each day. There is a willingness to listen - even by top physicians - to other employees' questions and input. Some say working with sick children would be depressing, but the environment here was always friendly and upbeat, and I worked on every floor and in every department.
cons: There are many higher-paid upper management nurses who squander dollars by wasting time chit chatting in the hallways, putting on a show about "how much work they have to do" when if they would just stop gossiping and do their work, they wouldn't be at work so late. I personally shared an office with a nurse educator who was the biggest drain of Children's dollars I've ever witnessed. Constant doctors visits, countless surgeries and reasons to be away from work, while sucking on benefits and high-paid salary. Others under these types doing the grunt work and get none of the credit.

pros: Facility provides superb healthcare to children in many locations.  Every patient is treated with dignity and respect without worrying about how payment will be obtained.
cons:
Management is a joke! Employees are micromanaged, treated poorly by their superiors (I’m sure their are some areas this does not apply), and have no voice. Management has no accountability for their actions. Management speaks down to employees and speaks of people publicly. In my area, bold face lies were told without any hesitation. I found that anyone will be thrown under the bus to cover errors. 

Some areas are permitted to work extended hours for weeks that contain holidays, other areas are not. I was advised during interview process that extended hours would be acceptable for my position. I learned later, this was not true. My manager advised me that PTO was required for all holidays and extended hours were not acceptable to cover the holiday. I was an exempt employee and worked well over my hours every week as required for projects. 

This review is from the business side.

review_title: Great employer, not so great department
job_title: School Medical Assistant in Akron, OH
pros: Staff care about their jobs, very positive atmosphere, high morale in most departments and units. Amazing hospital system, just don't work in School Health
cons: School Health management!  PTO policy is draconian (1 day off per month, must request 90 days in advance, not allowed off if anybody else in the 200+ person dept has requested that day already), pay is not on par with other departments' MAs

pros: This is a magnet facility that is well respected though out the state of ohio. the vision and culture of the hospital is a very positive one and reflects in the atmosphere. In general, workers appeared satisfied and happy to work here. The work in and for the community is commendable.
cons: My main complaint is the lower wage compared to surrounding hospitals. I have also heard by many that pay raises rarely happen and if it does it is such a low amount that it merely covers the increased cost of health benefits. the retirement benefits also don't appear to be competitive compared to other akron hospitals.

pros: you get to learn a lot and work amongst the best doctors and nurses. Great place to work to gain knowledge while in school if you are remaining in the medical field.
cons: very low pay compared to other hospitals and clinics around.

pros: This is a great place to work. There are a lot of good people who work here and believe in what they are doing to better the lives of children and their families. Pay for office positions is decent, comparable if not better than other companies in the area.
cons: There is not a lot of room for advancement for mid-level employees, unless you are a nurse or other medical staff. I am working at a skill level above my position without really having anywhere to advance or being compensated for it, which is really not going to keep me motivated long-term.

review_title: Great job! Admin lost focus of mission.
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Akron, OH
pros: The work you put in at ACH makes you feel like you are making a difference in the children's lives and their family. Coworkers were some of the best people I have ever worked with, and most felt the same way about the job. Benefits are decent, since when you get hurt you get treated on the job. Meet a lot of people and make connections.
cons: Pay is not competitive, not worth the work you put in at times. Unfortunately, management and administration seem to have forgotten what the company is about and run ACH like a corporation. More focused on innovation instead of quality of care and safety of staff.

pros:
colorful
lots of activities
no child is ever turned away for lack of payment/insurance
hospital as a whole goes above and beyond to provide care and be culturally aware of the patient population which is very diverse
always looking for ways to improve patient satisfaction
web based and instructor led trainings for career and personal development
when you are doing well, you will be praised
encourages education and helps to pay
cons:
politics and drama that you would find with any employer
promotions are based on who you know and not necessarily on what you know
hard to get fired, even when you are not performing to standard
you must stay in a position for one year before you can bid for a higher position

pros: ACH is great I recall when it used to be Rainbow Children's Hospital in the Akron area. They still remain committed to the children.
cons: Have pure autonomy among the departments. I would like to see more diversity in leadership roles. More men in clinical leadership roles such as director of nursing or an African American female in a team lead in clinical laboratory or IT&S. This is a rarity in Akron and Canton areas. It is fairly common in Cleveland area hospitals but is cut very short in Akron and Canton why. I have seen and interacted with many diverse groups teaching but none are hired in this area?

pros: It is a hospital for kids in our community. I do not believe all depts. are bad or the entire hospital just the one I was in.
cons:
Inconsistent training
No clear process
Management has favorites
No diversity
Sabotage and dog eat dog environment
Low Pay
Supervisors not knowledgeable.
Not welcoming to new people.
HR/management does not take new hire complaints seriously.
Only Nurses and Doctors matter. 
Management is not empathetic to employees they do not like or is new.

review_title: Great place to work if you love children
pros: The overall atmosphere is very welcoming. It is the best feeling to be able to assist in the care of a child. To get a smile is so rewarding. I loved working here
cons: Other than a small cost of living increase each year, there were no raises in the  6 years I was there. It seemed to make people look for other positions rather than being loyal to their department.

pros: ACH itself offers wonderful benefits, care, and an overall welcoming environment. I would and have recommended people to work within the system outside of my department.
cons: I worked at the Mahoning Valley branch in the offices, and the boss was just terrible. Higher up management knows the problem but can't seem to get rid of this person. So bad that when I gave my two MONTHS notice, I got all but screamed at for being irresponsible. That let me know I was definitely making the right choice to leave.

job_title: Pediatric Emergency RN in Massillon, OH
pros: Management promotes and supplements continuing education.  Great team work with employees and working to improve the health and lives of children keeps it positive on even a tough day. Benefits are competitive with other facilities and at least in Emergency, staff is usually able to help with scheduling conflicts between work and home.
cons: Pay rate is good but not great. Not a huge issue if you are there because you loving working with children.

pros: Many resources, decent benefits, opportunity for growth
cons: No incentive for things like floating, working off shifts, etc., concerns not properly addressed by management, staffing

review_title: A patient-family environment where caring and dedicated staff treat every child like their own.
pros: Great atmosphere, dedicated staff, generous  tuition reimbursement and other professional development incentives, ample opportunities to volunteer and give back, outstanding reputation in the community.
cons: No organization is perfect, but Children's is a great place to work. They understand the importance of recognizing their strengths and weaknesses.

pros: I worked here for over 6 years and only left because I moved out of state. Excellent care is provided and wonderful teamwork. Strives to fulfill the mission statement. Provides excellent opportunities for advancement and professional development. Strong shared governance structure.
cons: The organization is experiencing rapid growth and expansion but still strives to maintain the culture of a small, community hospital.

pros: It's easy to get behind the hospital's mission.
cons:
Minimal opportunities for career advancement for those in non-clinical positions. Non-clinical staff are overworked and underappreciated.
No life-work balance.
Expectation that exempt employees will continually work excessive hours.
Promotion is very much linked to who you know, not what you are capable of.
Management does not inspire trust.

pros: Great hours, wonderful and friendly staff and coworkers, amazing benefits, the satifying feeling of helping others, easy hands-on training, and a perfect position for college students
cons: The job requires you to sit at a desk for an 8 hour shift, unless you are the part-time person who gives breaks. Job can get a little slow at times. Any suggestions have to go through a committee to be approved, which can sometimes be a slow process.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Akron, OH
pros: Great culture, supportive coworkers, positive/social work environment, great management, excellent tuition reimbursement, Ice cream socials, etc, only Akron hospital that's never had layoffs. Always learning & staying engaged
cons:
Pay, PTO, lack of advancement for mid-level employees. 
Offer more wellness incentives or diversity in fitness options. Otherwise, great employer

pros: I loved working with the children. Very rewarding.
cons: Had a lot of turnovers in the front office with keeping secretaries. Lots of conflicts.

review_title: Enjoy being able to help kids.
pros: Great co-workers, continued company growth, good reputation in the area.
cons: The company constantly grows but doesn't provide the staff to support the areas of growth.

review_title: Was always proud to be part of the team
pros: Great benefits and always makes sure employees follow policy and procedures
cons: 13 years of excellent reviews and had one bad year because of a domestic  violence issue that was being taken care of and they terminated me

pros: Working with the families of the patients
cons: No one wants to lead the department always wants employees to follow-up with HR and HR says it is a departmental issue. No one to go to to give you answers

pros: I was proud to work for one of the top Children's hospitals in the country. I was treated well and the benefits were good.
cons: I felt that the compensation was poor and there was little room to make greater pay. Any raises I received were offset by by benefit costs going up.

review_title: It was a one in a lifetime job, where I learned great skills and was treated with respect by everyone.
pros: Everyone that worked there, worked as a team and not just for themselves.
cons: If you were sent home for being sick then it counted as an absence and went on your record.

review_title: Fairly satisfactory.  If you do not have a degree, there isn't much chance or opportunities for growth

pros: Great pay and benefits. Promotes health for patients and employees. Magnet hospital great co-workers. Promotes the advancement of employees. Very advance in medical and Healthcare delivery. Great place to work.

pros: Mission and vision as stated, opportunity to work in a variety of pediatric specialties, teaching hospital, only pediatric employer, healthcare benefits.

review_title: Epic Provider Liaison/ Credentialed Epic Orders Trainer
pros: Great people to my  work with and a great organization to work for. Being an epic trainer I reached the highest level I can and needed to move on and learn more.
cons: I cannot find a single thing to complain about.

pros: pediatric, able to help people, good job security, many fine people
